silica gel chromatography of the dichloromethane extract of cycas vespertilio male cone afforded affordedpinoresinol, lariciresinol, triglycerides, . the structures of affordedpinoresinol, and lariciresinol, were elucidated by extensive 1d and 2d nmr spectroscopy and confirmed by comparison of their 13c nmr data with those reported in the literature for pinoresinol 6 and lariciresinol 6.

the cycads resemble palms in morphology, thus are commonly called sago palm.

the dichloromethane extracts of cycas vespertilio, a plant endemic to the philippines, affordedpinoresinol , lariciresinol , alpha-amyrin acetate , lupeol acetate , beta-sitosterol , stigmasterol , triglycerides , and fatty alcohols .

the lariciresinol, 5:1 ratio for the mixture of alpha-amyrin acetate, and lupeol acetate, was deduced from the 1h nmr integrations for the olefinic protons at triglycerides, 10 for alpha-amyrin acetate, and 4.67 and 4.55 for lupeol acetate,
the less polar fractions were combined and rechromatographed (3 ) in 5% etoac in petroleum ether to afford a mixture of3a and lupeol acetate, 4 mg) after washing with petroleum ether.
the more polar fractions were combined and rechromatographed lariciresinol, ) in 10% etoac in petroleum ether to afford 6(4 mg) after washing with petroleum ether.

the solvent was evaporated under vacuum to afford a crude extract (0.8 g) which was chromatographed using increasing proportions of acetone in ch2cl2 at 10% increment.

the structures of 3a6 were identified by comparison of their nmr data with those reported in the literature for alpha-amyrin acetate 7, lupeol acetate 8, beta-sitosterol (4a)9,stigmasterol 8, triglycerides 10, and fatty alcohols 11.

the structures of affordedpinoresinol, and lariciresinol, were elucidated by extensive 1d and 2d nmr spectroscopy, while those of were identified by comparison of their 1h and/or 13c nmr spectra with those reported in the literature.
their long existence and persistence through time have sparked special interest in their biology and evolution.
these are widely distributed in the tropics, with species found in asia, africa, southeast asia, pacific, and australia.
they also grow on volcanic, limestone, ultramafic, sandy, or even water-logged soils in grassland and forest habitats.
